trans-unit.source: The TlsOperationException class is an exception that occurs in the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.StartTransportLayerSecurity*> method if the request fails.
The TlsOperationException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.TlsOperationException"></xref> class.
The TlsOperationException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.TlsOperationException"></xref> class using the specified response.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object returned by the server.
The TlsOperationException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.TlsOperationException"></xref> class using the specified message.
The message displayed to the client when the exception occurs.
The TlsOperationException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.TlsOperationException"></xref> class using the specified response and message.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object returned by the server.
The message displayed to the client when the exception occurs.

The TlsOperationException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.TlsOperationException"></xref> class using the specified serialization data and streaming context.
The data required to serialize the parameter.
The source and destination of the serialized stream associated with the parameter.
The TlsOperationException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.TlsOperationException"></xref> class using the specified message and inner exception.
The message displayed to the client when the exception occurs.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException*>, if any, that threw the exception.

The TlsOperationException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.TlsOperationException"></xref> class using the specified response, message, and inner exception.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object returned by the server.
The message displayed to the client when the exception occurs.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException*>, if any, that threw the exception.
